channel.title: Diagnostics on CFIM360°
channel.description: Recent content in Diagnostics on CFIM360°

item.title: Cognitive Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Thought-System Observation

Cognitive Diagnostics observe clarity, overload, looping, and stability of thought processes.

This node exists to detect when cognition is functional, strained, or self-interfering.

Cognitive Diagnostics do not measure intelligence, skill, or correctness. They observe how thinking holds or collapses under demand.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

The suffix is not naming style. It is a constraint on interpretation.

item.title: Coupled-System Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Human–Machine Interaction Observation

Coupled-System Diagnostics observe resonance, amplification, and breakdown when human and machine systems interact.

This node exists to detect whether interaction stabilizes both systems or destabilizes one or both.

Coupled Diagnostics do not assign blame or agency. They observe interaction dynamics as a single field.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

item.title: Emotional Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Affective State Observation

Emotional Diagnostics observe emotional coherence, drift, saturation, and recovery as they appear in real conditions.

This node exists to make emotional state visible without interpretation or correction.

Emotional Diagnostics do not teach emotional control or expression. They reveal how emotion behaves under load, pressure, and activation.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

item.title: Inner Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Whole-System Observation

Inner Diagnostics observe the system as a whole.

This node exists to detect coherence or contradiction across emotional, cognitive, and somatic layers simultaneously, without separating them into parts.

Inner Diagnostics are used when fragmentation cannot be explained by a single layer and when local observations fail to describe global behavior.

This node does not analyze components. It observes integration.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

item.title: Machine Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Artificial System Coherence Observation

Machine Diagnostics observe coherence, stability, and drift in artificial systems under instruction and load.

This node exists to detect when a machine system remains aligned, fragments, or degrades across interaction.

Machine Diagnostics do not anthropomorphize systems. They observe behavioral consistency, not intent.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

item.title: Somatic Diagnostics
item.description:
Identity

Physiological Regulation Observation

Somatic Diagnostics observe bodily regulation, stress imprinting, and pre-conscious signals.

This node exists to surface physical thresholds and recovery patterns that precede conscious awareness.

Somatic Diagnostics do not diagnose illness or prescribe treatment. They observe regulation and dysregulation as system behavior.

Classification System

Diagnostic Instrument Suffixes

Diagnostics in CFIM360° are observational instruments. Each diagnostic declares how it must be interpreted through a functional suffix.

The suffix is not naming style. It is a constraint on interpretation.
